# userLocationAnnotation

**Instance Property**

An annotation that indicates the user’s location on the map.

## Declaration

```swift
get userLocationAnnotation(): UserLocationAnnotation | null;
```

## Discussion

This is the annotation, or blue dot, that indicates the user’s location on the map. This property is `null` if:

- [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/Map/showsUserLocation] is `false`.
- MapKit JS is trying to acquire the user’s location.
- MapKit JS fails to acquire the user’s location.

The map’s [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/Map/annotations] property only holds annotations you can modify. MapKit JS doesn’t add the [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/Map/userLocationAnnotation] property to the annotations array, and you can’t remove it by using [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/Map/removeAnnotation]. Use [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/Map/selectedAnnotation] to reference the user’s location annotation when it’s in a selected state.

The default value of the [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/Annotation/collisionMode-data.property] property on the user’s location annotation is [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/CollisionMode/None]. The user’s location annotation doesn’t collide with other annotations unless you set the collision mode property to a value other than `None`.

## Displaying the user’s location

- **showsUserLocation**: A Boolean value that determines whether to show the user’s location on the map.
- **tracksUserLocation**: A Boolean value that determines whether to center the map on the user’s location.
